US stocks tick higher as inflation rises moderately in July
summary: Wall Street's main indexes experienced an upward surge at the opening bell on Tuesday, buoyed by inflation data for July that largely met expectations. This development has increased the likelihood of the Federal Reserve reducing interest rates in the coming month.
fullContent: Wall Street's main indexes experienced an upward surge at the opening bell on Tuesday, buoyed by inflation data for July that largely met expectations. This development has increased the likelihood of the Federal Reserve reducing interest rates in the coming month. The Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq all saw gains, reflecting investor optimism.

title: Europe’s Flawed Investment Strategy
summary: From the Lisbon Strategy of 2000 to the competitiveness compass today, the idea that more investment is the key to economic success has proved potent in Europe. But decades of economic stagnation in Japan have shown that high levels of investment are not a panacea.
fullContent: From the Lisbon Strategy of 2000 to the competitiveness compass today, the idea that more investment is the key to economic success has proved potent in Europe. But decades of economic stagnation in Japan have shown that high levels of investment are not a panacea.

title: My husband is 10 years older than me. The age gap was noticeable when we first started parenting, but now I see it as an asset.
